questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: Describe the weather conditions necessary for a blizzard to form over the northern Great Plains.
questions.answer: A blizzard implies strong winds hence the storm requires a strong pressure gradient.  A strong pressure gradient will occur when the central pressure of the storm is exceptionally low which can occur is exceptionally strong divergence occurs over the cyclone.  To get a strong divergence requires a strong jet stream which in turn requires an intense temperature gradient at the surface.

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: What causes the wind to blow?
questions.answer: Wind will blow if there is a gradient in pressure in the horizontal.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: How does a steep (or strong) pressure gradient appear on a weather map?
questions.answer: A strong pressure gradient is represented as isobars close together.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: Explain how converging air and diverging air forms at the surface and aloft.
questions.answer: (a) Surface air converges towards the center of a low and diverges from the center of a high.    (b) a region of converging air usually forms on the west side of an upper-level trough and a region of diverging air forms on the east side.

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: Why do the majority of tornadoes move from southwest to northeast?
questions.answer: Tornadoes are associated with supercell thunderstorms which are caused in part by strong divergence aloft.  Divergence tends to be strongest in the southwest flow ahead of an upper-air trough.

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_190927
questions.main: Explain this fact: Without upper-level divergence a surface open wave cyclone would probably persist for less than a day.
questions.answer: Air spirals into a surface low due to the effect of friction on air flow. Unless divergence exists above the low it will fill in quickly and dissipate.
